dataset.title: GFNMS: Physical Oceanography: moored temperature data: Southeast Farallon Island, California, USA (SEF001)

creator.organizationName: Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary (GFNMS)

abstract.para: This metadata record describes moored seawater temperature data collected at Southeast Farallon Island, California, USA, by GFNMS. Measurements were collected using a StowAway Tidbit Temperature Logger (Onset Computer Corp. TBIC32+4+27) beginning 2006-01-05. The instrument depth was 004 meters, in an overall water depth of 24 meters (both relative to Mean Sea Level, MSL). The sampling interval was 2.0 minutes.

keywordSet.keyword: EARTH SCIENCE : Oceans : Ocean Temperature : Water Temperature

intellectualRights.para: Please cite Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary and Bodega Marine Laboratory in all publications containing these data. Please send copies of any published manuscript based on these data to the BML principal investigator John Largier and to the GFNMS Research Coordinator, Jan Roletto. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects. are integrally dependent on GFNMS/BML data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original GFNMS/BML investigators.

Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and GFNMS/BML will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.

NOAA makes no warranty regarding these data, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty. NOAA, NESDIS and NODC cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in these data, nor as a result of the failure of these data to function on a particular system.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Southeast Farallon Island: SEF001: This mooring is located near Southeast Farallon Island, California, USA. The mooring lies in an overall water depth of 022 meters (referenced to Mean Sea Level, MSL). The altitudeMinimum and altitudeMaximum tags in this initial coverage section refer to the logger measurement range (with depths expressed as negative altitudes) and are also referenced to MSL. They do not represent the overall water depth.

purpose.para: These data were collected by GFNMS/BML to understand the physical processes of the inner continental shelf and their potential effects on marine ecology.

description.para: Methods for moored temperature collection and quality-control are available online, see the protocol citation.

protocol.title: GFNMS moored temperature collection and quality-control methods No. 1

methodStep.instrumentation: StowAway Tidbit Temperature Logger (Onset Computer Corp. TBIC32+4+27)

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: In this sampling section, the altitudeMaximum tag refers to the altitude of Mean Sea Level (MSL), and the altitudeMinimum tag refers to the nominal altitude of the sea floor. In other words, the altitudeMinimum represents the overall water depth, expressed as a negative altitude.

samplingDescription.para: Methods for GFNMS/BML moored temperature data collection and quality-control are available online, see the protocol citation. Data were collected using a StowAway Tidbit Temperature Logger (Onset Computer Corp. TBIC32+4+27) set to a 2.0-minute sampling interval.

project.title: Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary (GFNMS)

abstract.para: The mission of NOAA's National Marine Sanctuaries is to serve as the trustee for the nation's system of marine protected areas, to conserve, protect, and enhance their biodiversity, ecological integrity and cultural legacy.

attribute.attributeDefinition: calendar date of each temperature measurement record
Greenwich Mean Time of each temperature measurement record

accuracy.attributeAccuracyReport: 100 ppm, or 52.6 minutes/year, from Onset Manuals

attribute.attributeDefinition: Time of each temperature measurement record, expressed as decimal days since 12 a.m. Jan. 1 of the year measurement was made. For example, 12 noon GMT on Jan. 2 is represented by yearday 1.5, NOT yearday 2.5.

accuracy.attributeAccuracyReport: 100 ppm, or 52.6 minutes/year, from Onset Manuals

attribute.attributeDefinition: data flag used to qualify data as bad, questionable, etc.

textDomain.definition: Data for each column of the data file are flagged with a single alpha-numeric code such that the first digit holds the first data column flag, the second digit holds the second data column flag, etc. Possible flags are 0-9, A-Z, a-z; however flag definitions are currently as follows: 0 - No known bad data; 1 - Known bad data: instrument malfunction/failure, loss of memory, loss of power, bio-fouling, electronic malfunction; 2 - Suspicious data (looks bad, but no known cause); 9 - Missing data (data column has a missing value code as defined in the metadata)
textDomain.source: PISCO/NMS Physical Oceanography Team accepted flagging conventions
